line_1: To hit the young ane's fancies;
line_2: He sings, he plays, he dances,

line_1: Behold me and my airy Fancies
Pough! pr'ythee ne'er trouble thy Head with such Fancies:
line_2: Rely on the Aid You shall have from Saint Francis:

line_1: Ne power, ne such like idle fancies,
line_2: Sweet Agnes grant to father Francis;
Unless, my dear, you read romances,
And building truths on known romances.

line_1: While Men have these Ambitious Fancies;
You little know the freaks and fancies,
line_2: The ups and downs, and pranks and prances

line_1: My Lady had her earthly fancies.
line_2: Thus, while I had my heavenly trances,
